metadata.title: CVE-2018-6148 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Incorrect implementation in Content Security Policy in Google Chrome priorto 67.0.3396.79 allowed a remote attacker to bypass navigation restrictionsvia a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6148` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
chromium-browser-l10n - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
chromium-chromedriver - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'Ubuntu touch end-of-life').
